comments.body: @carolyncole I checked https://bibdata-alma-staging.princeton.edu/locations/holding_locations and the recap locations you listed plus the scsbcul, scsbnypl have 'Recap EDD': true.

same for https://bibdata-alma.princeton.edu/locations/holding_locations

![Screen Shot 2021-07-08 at 9 43 33 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/124932346-ff0a7880-dfd0-11eb-9236-352303a8c2c8.png)

To bring this back in from slack.  The old recap$ locations for items in libraries should be removed.  They are no longer in use.  For instance recap$pk is now in alma as mendel$pk.  medel$pk has the recap edd flag set incorrectly.

@mzelesky and ideas on how to map between the old rcppk and the new locations?  It seems like it is just replace rcp with the correct library so if I am right the ones that need the edd flag set correctly would be

 rcpgp => firestone$gp , rcppb => firestone$pa, rcppj => marquand$pj, rcppk => mendel$pk, rcppn => lewis$pn, rcppq => plasma$pq, rcppt => engineering$pt, rcppw => architecture$pw, rcpxw => rare$xw

not sure how rcpjq, rcppa translate since they are just recap locations not related to a library.
@mzelesky @kevinreiss  if there is a mapping please update this issue with a translation map https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1199
Mapping is at https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LKypZZQNu3zy2lSZf_V-QgoV5FfZcILUrlk8BfRDqRM/edit#gid=0. I added column that says if the location is eligible for EDD at ReCAP.

I might have done the wrong search but I looked for physical items with base status in mendel$pk https://princeton.alma.exlibrisgroup.com/ng/page;u=%2Frep%2Faction%2FpageAction.search.physical_item_results.xml.do%3FxmlFileName%3Dsearch.physical_item_results.xml&RequestBeanClassName%3Dcom.exlibris.repository.web.search.RepositorySearchBean&pageViewMode%3DEdit&pageBean.advancedSearchPerformed%3Dtrue&pageBean.searchMode%3DAdvanced&pageBean.securityHashToken%3D4900755837146601384 and it returned 349

and physical items with base status in recap$pk and it returned 10,525. 

I don't think we should remove the recap$pk from the locations table. right?

I will update the existing mapping file https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/alma/voyager_alma_mapping.csv with the new 'EDD allowed' column @kevinreiss added in https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LKypZZQNu3zy2lSZf_V-QgoV5FfZcILUrlk8BfRDqRM/edit#gid=0

@carolyncole for now I will not remove the old recap locations because the searches I did return different numbers which means that a lot of items are in the old locations. I will move forward to update the recap_edd flags of the new locations.

I will use the updated file that @mzelesky updated 2 weeks ago https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18YCL_PoGMjybNHplVpVhdk-fEgPrTHHxU2VvNcpOTBI/edit#gid=0 to regenerate the locations file. 
@mzelesky said that I can remove recap$pk (old recap locations) since all the items will be up to date on July 26th. Thanks @mzelesky .

Based on the updated file that @mzelesky provided and the updated list that @carolyncole and @kevinreiss provided for the recap_edd: true, the mapping for the new recap locations and recap_edd:true is:
1. rcpgp -> recap$gp,  
2. rcpjq -> recap$jq
3. rcppa -> recap$pa
4. rcppb -> firestone$pb
5. rcppj -> marquand$pj
6. rcppk -> mendel$pk
7. rcppn -> lewis$pn
8. rcppq -> recap$pq
9. rcppt -> engineer$pt
10. rcppw -> arch$pw
11. rcpxw -> rare$xw
12. etasrcp -> online$etasrcp
13. scsbcul (partners not alma)
14. scsbnypl (partners not alma)
15. scsbhl (partners not alma)

This is a screenshot from my local:
![Screen Shot 2021-07-08 at 9 55 19 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/125011866-3c095600-e037-11eb-8596-9341e609bb27.png)

@smallfind I can get new DCL numbers. Just to be clear, it looks like the first two items are good (the second one has a manually-entered DCL number = dcl:s52, so I just need to get a new DCL number and add it to the third item (https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/9dac5565-e0b8-483d-be01-cc00d21cd7fa). Is that right?
That sounds right, yeah!
@smallfind OK, I've taken `dcl:bd2` from the list of available DCL numbers, so you can add it to https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/9dac5565-e0b8-483d-be01-cc00d21cd7fa when you're ready

Great! (I'll have to put a note in to change it in Alma, as Voyager is closed and I'm not sure if I can change this in Alma yet.)

Thanks.

@smallfind 👍🏻 I went ahead and put `dcl:bd2` in the local identifier field — though I notice that it's still using `dcl:s52` in the manifest (taken from the MARC record). So fixing this in Alma so that is updated sounds good.
Got it. I made the edits in the Marquand cataloging location. I am hoping that this appears in the OPAC overnight.
